meanings.definition: A sensory receptor that responds to changes in temperature.
meanings.sent1: The thermoreceptors in my skin help me feel if something is hot or cold.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study thermoreceptors to understand how our bodies sense temperature.
meanings.sent3: The thermoreceptors in the room were so sensitive, they could tell when someone opened the door.
meanings.sent4: Her thermoreceptors were like tiny detectives, always on the lookout for any temperature changes.
meanings.sent5: The thermoreceptors, like tiny temperature sensors, sent signals to the brain about the warmth of the sun.

meanings.definition: Cells that detect temperature changes in the body.
meanings.sent1: Scientists discovered new thermoreceptors in the human body that help regulate temperature.
meanings.sent2: When you feel cold, your thermoreceptors send signals to your brain to put on a jacket.
meanings.sent3: The thermoreceptors in the body were like little helpers, always making sure everything was just right.
meanings.sent4: His thermoreceptors worked tirelessly, ensuring his body stayed at the perfect temperature.
meanings.sent5: The thermoreceptors, like diligent workers, kept the body informed about any changes in temperature.
